snippet: Police Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly said the department would begin using the term “collision” instead of “accident.”
abstract: New York Police Department policy change has the department conducting robust investigations of traffic crashes that result in critical injuries, but not certain or likely death as was policy in past; department, in symbolic change, will begin using term 'collision' instead of accident to describe crashes.

byline.original: By MATT FLEGENHEIMER and J. DAVID GOODMAN

lead_paragraph: Police Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly said the department would begin using the term “collision” instead of “accident.”

headline.seo: ‘Collision’ Replacing ‘Accident’ for N.Y.C. Police Traffic Crash Squad
headline.main: After Criticism, Police Change Policy and Begin Investigating More Traffic Crashes
headline.print_headline: After Criticism, Police Change Policy and Begin Investigating More Traffic Crashes
